text.section: In cooperation with the institutions of higher education in the State, the Commission shall establish and administer a Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to provide financial assistance to full-time and part-time students in the fields of medicine, dentistry, law, pharmacy, nursing, social work, and veterinary medicine.
A graduate and professional scholarship award for a single school year may not be less than $1,000 or more than $5,000.
A recipient may not receive an award for longer than 8 semesters.

section.section: The Commission shall allocate grants for the Program to the institutions of higher education specified in subsection (b)(3) of this section based on the proportion of State residents enrolled in eligible programs at each institution.
An institution of higher education that receives a grant under this section shall provide the Commission with an annual audit describing the disposition of the funds.

text.section:
The Commission shall:
Establish guidelines for the awarding of graduate and professional scholarships by the institutions of higher education to the students; and
Adopt regulations necessary for the implementation of this section.
Funds for the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program shall be as provided in the State budget and as set forth in § 13-613 of the Transportation Article.
